sections.title: Engineer Your Ideal Allocation
sections.subtitle: Compare popular asset allocation frameworks and tailor one to your goals

sections.title: Workshop Objectives
items: Understand key allocation models (60/40, risk parity, glide paths)
Assess how age, timeline, and risk tolerance influence allocations
Document rebalancing rules to keep allocations on track

sections.title: Allocation Sets the Risk Budget
sections.content: Your mix of stocks, bonds, cash, and alternatives drives more than 80% of long-term return variation. Picking the right mix for your objectives matters more than chasing hot funds.

points.title: Classic 60/40
points.description: A balanced split between equities and bonds, suitable for moderate-risk investors with long horizons.

points.title: Age-Based Glide Path
points.description: Gradually reduces equity exposure as you approach retirement to preserve capital.

points.title: Risk Parity
points.description: Allocates based on volatility contribution so each asset class adds similar risk.

sections.title: Allocation First, Investments Second
sections.content: Choose the percentage mix before picking specific funds—it reduces bias and keeps you strategic.

sections.title: Allocation Builder
steps: List your financial goals, time horizon, and risk tolerance (conservative, moderate, aggressive).
Select a base model (e.g., 70/30) that matches your profile and note why.
Adjust for personal factors—pension income, real estate holdings, concentrated stock positions.
Assign target percentages to equities (U.S./international), fixed income, cash, and alternatives.
Define rebalancing rules (threshold or schedule) and record them in your investment policy statement.

sections.title: Stress-Test
sections.content: Run historical scenario analysis on your allocation to see how it performed in past downturns.
